text: FADE IN: The sun shines brightly over a bustling urban landscape. People move hurriedly, oblivious to the tension brewing beneath the surface.

DETECTIVE JAMES WILSON (30s), a dedicated officer with a strong moral compass, reviews case files at his desk. His partner, OFFICER LUCAS REED (30s), leans against the wall, flipping through a magazine.
LUCAS
You know, James, sometimes you gotta bend the rules to get the job done.
JAMES
That’s not how it works, Lucas. We uphold the law.
Students: What type of misconduct is Lucas suggesting?

A tense staff meeting. CAPTAIN RIVERA (50s) addresses the team, highlighting a rise in crime rates.
CAPTAIN RIVERA
We need to be more proactive. Get creative with your tactics.
JAMES
(raising his hand)
With all due respect, Captain, we can’t sacrifice our integrity.
Students: What pressures might officers feel in this situation?

choices.text: D) Fear of losing their job

text:
James and Lucas stake out a known drug hotspot. They witness a drug deal going down. Lucas nudges James, excited.
LUCAS
Let’s move in.
JAMES
We need backup. This isn’t safe.
LUCAS
What if we just scare them? A little intimidation never hurt anyone.
Students: What type of misconduct does Lucas’s suggestion involve?

James is at his desk, reflecting on the night before. A MESSAGE pops up on his computer: “Need your help. Call me.” It’s from LUCAS.
INT. ABANDONED WAREHOUSE - NIGHT
Lucas meets with a GROUP OF CROOKS, exchanging information. James arrives, clearly uncomfortable.
JAMES
What are you doing, Lucas?
LUCAS
Relax, we’re just gathering intel.
Lucas hands over a small sum of money for information. James watches, horrified.
JAMES
We can’t pay them! That’s misconduct.
Students: What kind of misconduct is happening here?

James sits alone, staring at a bottle of whiskey. He picks up his phone and calls Lucas.
JAMES
I can’t do this anymore.
LUCAS (V.O.)
(smirking)
You’re already in, James. No turning back now.
Students: How does peer pressure contribute to misconduct?

James’s demeanor has changed. He’s more aggressive, bending the rules, and showing signs of corruption. He finds himself involved in an illegal drug bust, pocketing evidence for personal gain.
Students: What is the nature of James’s misconduct?

James meets with shady characters, discussing more illicit activities. A SENSE OF DREAD fills the air.
SHADY CHARACTER
You’re one of us now. Just don’t get caught.
James smirks, but a flicker of doubt crosses his face.
Students: What consequences could James face for this association?

James is called into Captain Rivera’s office. Two INTERNAL AFFAIRS OFFICERS stand waiting.
CAPTAIN RIVERA
James, we need to talk about your recent activities.
James’s heart races as he realizes he’s been set up. He feels the walls closing in.
INTERNAL AFFAIRS OFFICER
(somber)
You’ve crossed a line, Detective.
Students: What types of misconduct have been highlighted in James’s story?
James walks out of the station, defeated. His badge is stripped away.
finalMessage: The story of Detective James Wilson serves as a cautionary tale about the slippery slope of ethical compromises in law enforcement. Even small ethical violations can lead to more serious corruption over time.
